DataElement.preferredName: Study Subject Breast Reduced Laterality Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to represent laterality of the breast reduction.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A matter or person that is analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or treated in the course of particular study.

Concepts.definition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Side of body from which specimen originates.._A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Thesaurus._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Behavioral manifestations of cerebral dominance in which there is preferential use and superior functioning of either the left or the right side, as in the preferred use of the right hand or right foot.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
